sense.name: cease exertion or action; relax; sleep
sense.examples: Let's rest here in the shade. Quiet; he's resting. The birds rested high in the tree. The committee is resting over the summer. Rest assured, I won't stop until I've found her.

sense.name: (cause to) be situated, fixed, or supported
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[patient[concrete]] REST PP[locative] NP1[agent] REST NP2[patient[concrete]] PP[locative]
sense.examples: The unusual split-level Colonial rests in a peaceful portion of the town. He earmarked the very place where President Washington had rested his hand. Rest your head on my shoulder. The book rests in a place of honor on the shelf. Here rests an honored soldier. She rested the cane against the wall.

sense.name: give a rest to; cause to be inactive
sense.examples: Alexander then rested his troops. You need to rest that leg. We sold 300 of these lambs and rested the field for two weeks.

sense.name: rely on; be vested in
sense.examples: Libby's fate now rests in the hands of the jury. Apple smart phone project rests on Mac OS X tie-ins. Her account of the phenomenon rests on a misleading use of statistics. The responsibility rests with the Allies.

sense.name: LEGAL: voluntarily end the presentation of evidence
sense.examples: The prosecution rested today in the Simpson trial. The appellant then rested his case.
